crnrstn_element.crnrstn_description: To retrieve data stored in a cookie sent to the client through addEncryptedCookie(), simply pass the $name of the cookie to getEncryptedCookie(), and the value will be returned if it is available.
crnrstn_element.crnrstn_returnedvalue: The value stored in the cookie...as it was conveyed to $_COOKIE by the browser during its most resent request to the server.

crnrstn_techspecscontent.crnrstn_techspec: It is recommended that you upgrade to the latest version of PHP to take advantage of the latests gains in security and processing efficiency.
Currently tested on an Ubuntu Server 16.04 running PHP 7.0.22 and Redhat Linux running PHP 5.5.38.

Data stored in cookies created through the invocation of addCookie() or the cookie_manager :: class constructor cannot be retrieved via getEncryptedCookie(). The getEncryptedCookie() method will not return useful cookie data where encryption has NOT been used.
